instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3436: What is 820-3436? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.SSD_RESET_CONN_L: What is SSD_RESET_CONN_L? SSD_RESET_CONN_L is a signal that goes to the SSD that will put it in RESET mode which will keep it from working, when SSD_RESET_L is present. _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, green light no fan spin
visual inspection, dirty, ssd getting warm
rails
ppbus 12.58 pp5vs5 5v pp3v3s5 3.3
pp3v3s4 0.45v 3v3 sus 1.94 3v3s3 0
pp3v3 s4 fet 0.334 pp5vs4 reg 0 <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> 0 (no i did not rehot cpu bro)
replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, cpu warm still no sys pwrok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: If CPU and SSD are getting warm then some rails must be powering on. Check voltages on CPU Vcore and other coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0 obviously,    pp3v3 s0. 1.9v 3v3 sus 3.3         3v3s4  0.444     other coils?  the point is im missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, without this the cpu wont power on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: How is the CPU getting warm then? Some rail to the CPU must be powering it, same goes for the SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
it would be nice if i had some hints, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL>  3.3v  <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL>  0        <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 1.725   <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>  2.781
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCST</SIGNAL>  0        <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>   0,  cpu is no longer getting warm, so can we go back to the original issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> should not be high. <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> at 1.7V is very strange as this is pulled up from <SIGNAL>3V_S0</SIGNAL>.  <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL> at 2.7V is also weird, signal is also pulled up from <SIGNAL>3V_S0</SIGNAL>. What is the voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>?

Some history on this board may also help as I truly have no idea what is going on here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
history is strange and sounds like water damage, but isnt. one day working next it was dead. because this one is weird ive posted here before messing with it

pp3v3 s0 1.939

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3436</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: This is really just a stab in the dark, but check PPVRTC, corrosion around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>/1900/6100.
